content:
Hi everyone,

I've spent a month now learning Rust in my spare time and I'm here to:

  • participate in the Rust Code Reading club
  • find open source projects (with kind maintainers and mentors) I can contribute to
  • get ideas for projects to embark on
  • and to generally have fun learning and building with Rust.

Welcome! What sort of projects are you looking to work on? Clippy has lots of mentors :) or if you want to build something self-contained there are lots of cool projects on the web like a raytracer or mini web server.

Thank you for the suggestions @Joshua Nelson. I'm going to explore building Ray Tracer in Rust.

I've just gone searched for materials online, and I'm going with the Ray Tracing Challenge book.
I'll take a look at Clippy too.

Hi! I'm fairly new to Rust, completed the Rust Book and loved every page. Then I made a VS Code extension called rustnote to run Rust code like a Jupyter Notebook (literate programming style). I'm figuring out how to integrate that extension with Rust analyzer now. Started the Youtube series Explaining Rust Analyzer which bought me here!

Jack Clayton said:

Hi! I'm fairly new to Rust, completed the Rust Book and loved every page. Then I made a VS Code extension called rustnote to run Rust code like a Jupyter Notebook (literate programming style). I'm figuring out how to integrate that extension with Rust analyzer now. Started the Youtube series Explaining Rust Analyzer which bought me here!

I haven't tried it, but you might want to take a look at evxcr. It includes a Rust Jupyter kernel and integrates with rust-analyzer (or maybe some of its crates).
Thanks @Laurențiu, I'll check that out, had come across it didn't realize they integrated Rust Analyzer thanks.
Legend thanks found this: https://github.com/google/evcxr/blob/711d1f58da11f3f9634bd0a5902409e38d350b63/evcxr/src/rust_analyzer.rs, not much to it at all!
